intro: Anemotrochus eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers with five petals, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to arid environments. Anemotrochus eggersii is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to coastal and inland regions with limited water availability.
